trans-unit.source: How to define and manage service state in Service Fabric
trans-unit.target: How to define and manage service state in Service Fabric

trans-unit.source: Service State
trans-unit.target: Service State

trans-unit.source: Service State is the data the service requires in order to function.
trans-unit.target: Service State is the data the service requires in order to function.

trans-unit.source: It is the data structures and variables that the service reads and writes in order to do work.
trans-unit.target: It is the data structures and variables that the service reads and writes in order to do work.

trans-unit.source: For example: Consider a simple calculator service.
trans-unit.target: For example: Consider a simple calculator service.

trans-unit.source: This service takes two numbers and returns their sum.
trans-unit.target: This service takes two numbers and returns their sum.

trans-unit.source: This is a purely stateless service that has no data associated with it.
trans-unit.target: This is a purely stateless service that has no data associated with it.

trans-unit.source: Now, consider the same calculator but in addition to computing sum it also has a method to return the last sum it had computed.
trans-unit.target: Now, consider the same calculator but in addition to computing sum it also has a method to return the last sum it had computed.

trans-unit.source: This service is now stateful - it contains some state that it writes to (when it computes a new sum) and reads from (when it returns the last computed sum).
trans-unit.target: This service is now stateful - it contains some state that it writes to (when it computes a new sum) and reads from (when it returns the last computed sum).

trans-unit.source: In Service Fabric, the first service is called a Stateless Service.
trans-unit.target: In Service Fabric, the first service is called a Stateless Service.

trans-unit.source: The second service is called a Stateful Service.
trans-unit.target: The second service is called a Stateful Service.

trans-unit.source: Storing Service State
trans-unit.target: Storing Service State

trans-unit.source: State can either be externalized or co-located with the code that is manipulating the state.
trans-unit.target: State can either be externalized or co-located with the code that is manipulating the state.

trans-unit.source: Externalization of state is typically done by using an external database or store.
trans-unit.target: Externalization of state is typically done by using an external database or store.

trans-unit.source: In our calculator example, this could be a SQL database where the current result is stored in a table.
trans-unit.target: In our calculator example, this could be a SQL database where the current result is stored in a table.

trans-unit.source: Every request to compute the sum performs an update on this row.
trans-unit.target: Every request to compute the sum performs an update on this row.

trans-unit.source: State can also be co-located with the code that manipulates this code.
trans-unit.target: State can also be co-located with the code that manipulates this code.

trans-unit.source: Stateful services in Service Fabric are built using this model.
trans-unit.target: Stateful services in Service Fabric are built using this model.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric provides the infrastructure to ensure this state is highly available and fault tolerant in the event of failures.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric provides the infrastructure to ensure this state is highly available and fault tolerant in the event of failures.
